Ben, I would think that our willingful blindness to CCP-fostered systematic transgressions in our markets would qualify as part of the “It” that needs to be burned down. There is nowhere CCP’s co-option of American elite is on starker display than in the investment industry.

The CCP is a corrosive force globally for clean governance and human rights. Providing liquid markets (and capital) to PRC companies furthers this and provides the PRC with more leverage over us, which recently seems like it might be a slight problem.

In HK, PRC manipulators routinely steal money from foreign shareholders by manipulating market caps to levels where  (which cowardly caved to the CCP by upping China weighting) adds them to the index. The manipulators smack Vanguard/Blackrock bids & once again 0 recourse.

In this Der Spiegel interview (Google Translate), Chris Hohn states it exactly how it is in Germany. But this is why MW is NOT short $WDI.GY . Going short WDI is going long German rule of law in the markets. Even now, we see that as a coin flip at best.

TV viewers attention is sold to advertisers, but not to the extent than $FB users are. TV produces content, which is arguably the "product". Users produce the bulk of FB content. FB allows advertisers to target in ways far more personal than TV advertising.

This statement by $FB is incredibly disingenuous. Users ARE the product. They are sold to advertisers, which is how FB generates revenue. If the company publicly denies users are the product, it has not yet come to Jesus.
